message: So while convore will be the channel for organized discussion I also like watching what's happening on Twitter
It's using websockets + a flash fallback so iOS / Android are supported, plus any browser that has websockets support or a working flash plugin :)
I put a real-time stream here: http://pycon.bruno.im/
@brutasse https://github.com/brutasse/django-floppyforms seems quite interesting and useful! :D
that way we get one stop shopping.
@brutasse are you using socket.io  or just your implementation?
@brutasse You should add convore comments (via the API) to the live stream
and thanks
@jamespaxi oh yes it is! can't start a project without it now :)
@jamespaxi it's a custom implementation using asyncore
oh wait, maybe not. I'll definitely look at this tonight
@jessenoller hehe... Right now the websockets server is tied to the twitter client, I need to decouple them first
if anyone's interested, https://github.com/brutasse/django-twitsocket/blob/master/twitsocket/management/commands/websockets.py
basically all the websockets code is in the file above, plus a very basic HTTP/OAuth streaming client
@brutasse cool, you got quite the number of open source projects I see :)
@brutasse can't wait to try this out in my next project! :)
Paging @ericflo for convore synergy :)
@yarkot you're welcome! working on adding Convore right now :)
FWIW https://gist.github.com/835862
@brutasse Thanks for both putting this up, and for the link to the sources - awesome! :-)
@ericflo ok I misunderstood, this is the other way :) Is this bot live?
@ericflo ah nice... I need it to use asyncore though, not sure if I can use it directly
@brutasse Nope the bot isn't live yet
Convore support is live on http://pycon.bruno.im - thanks for the suggestion @jessenoller :)
Yeah. That's great! I was just checking your live stream and saw Convore was there too. Thanks @brutasse!
